title: Hong Kong Defends the Arrests of Journalists
text:
Apart from seeking a license to deal with the property, the person affected by such notice may apply to the Court of First Instance for the "freezing notice" to be revoked.

Countries around the world take threats to national security extremely seriously. China, with Hong Kong as its special administrative region, is no different. Hong Kong remains a secure, open and dynamic environment that welcomes investors and entrepreneurs from around the world.

John K.C. Lee

Secretary for security

Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

---

The arrest of Ryan Law, the editor of Apple Daily, is another nail in the coffin of Hong Kong's diminished independence, and as you write in your editorial, "Businesses of all kinds, beware." What Beijing fails to grasp -- and never will because it is a dictatorship -- is that acts like arresting Mr. Law establish that it cannot be trusted about anything, and that it will twist and manipulate false laws to perpetuate its grip on the throats of talented Chinese people. World, beware.

James Tuthill

Oro Valley, Ariz.

(See related letter: "Letters to the Editor: Hong Kong Tries and Fails To Defend the Indefensible" -- WSJ June 29, 2021)
